intro: Dioctis bicorne, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive, sharply pointed seed pods that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Dioctis bicorne is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like the opium poppy.
